intro: Arctotis rueppellii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and chrysanthemums. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow or orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller florets. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Arctotis rueppellii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
